comment.author: 31498734@N05
comment._content: Certainly doesn't have a pier now.  I wonder where it was.

comment.author: 98587630@N00
comment._content: From National Maritime Museum's description: "Minehead Pier was completed in 1901, and played an important part in the town’s development as a holiday destination. It served the steamers which brought tourists to the resort from the industrial areas of South Wales. The pier was demolished during the Second World War as it obscured the line of fire to the Channel. "

comment.author: 73846351@N00
comment._content: I'm fairly certain I read that it was from the pebble beach beyond the harbour!
